item.title: Managing External Commands in Elixir with Ports
item.description: Background Elixir and OTP excel at asynchronous and long-running tasks, and likewise, they seem like a great fit for interfacing with the non-Elixir world, particularly being able to shell-out and monitor a long running external OS process. In the Ruby world, we often reach for tools like Sidekiq or Resque to run these commands asynchronously, outside of the normal HTTP request/response cycle that we’re used to when we usually build an app or API with Rails.
